what the C2 PA is you are creating
what's called a manifest that has
information about that digital asset
whether it's a video or an image and the
Manifest is really has three main
structures to it in one part there are
what are called assertions right these
are uh statements of fact about that
digital asset so it can be things like
uh when was this created uh what devices
were used to create this digital asset
um where copyright holders what's the
description so with these
assertions they take each of these
assertions these statements of facts and
they'll cryptographically hash that fact
that information and all of these hashes
go into what's called a claim and what
happens then is if someone tries a
malicious party tries to change those
assertion values it's not going to match
the hash anymore so you'll know that
it's been tampered with and then to make
sure that no one tries to go in and
change those hash values that claim that
claim is going to be uh signed with a
digital certificate and so that
signature basically seals the Manifest
so that you know and can have confidence
that nothing has been tampered with that
any changes will be tamper
